text: The arrondissement of Vendôme is an arrondissement of France, in the Loir-et- Cher department of the Centre-Val de Loire region. Its capital is the city of Vendôme. ==History== When the Loir-et-Cher department was created on 1800, the arrondissement of Vendôme was part of that original department. ==Geography== The arrondissement of Vendôme is the most northern arrondissement in the Loir- et-Cher department. It is the smallest arrondissement of the department, , and the one with fewest people living in it, with 70,205 inhabitants. It is bordered to the north by the Eure-et-Loir department, to the east by the arrondissement of Blois, to the south by the Indre-et-Loire department and to the west by the Sarthe department. ==Composition== ===Cantons=== After the reorganisation of the cantons in France, cantons are not subdivisions of the arrondissements so they could have communes that belong to different arrondissements. The cantons in the arrondissement of Vendôme are: # Montoire- sur-le-Loir (4106) # Le Perche (4109) # Vendôme (4114) ===Communes=== The arrondissement of Vendôme has 105 communes; they are (with their
